rules: Rule1: If the tools are organized, then the tools are accessible.

Rule2: Whenever the repair is in the diagnostic phase, if it is not the case that if the technician is not familiar with the schematics then the multimeter is not functional, then the manual was consulted, and this leads to the fault being identified.

Rule3: Under the condition that the repair is in the repair phase, if it is not the case that if the technician is not familiar with the schematics then the multimeter is not functional, then the manual was consulted, and this results in the fault being identified.
Rule4: If an initial assessment of the device was performed, then the repair is in the diagnostic phase.
Rule5: Either an initial assessment of the device was performed or a detailed inspection of the device was performed.
Rule6: Provided that a detailed inspection of the device was performed, the repair is in the repair phase.
Rule7: If the technician is capable of repairing the device, then if the motherboard can be salvaged, it is not the case that the motherboard is damaged.
Rule8: Either there is a safety violation in the workshop, or if the technician is skilled, then the technician is capable of repairing the device.
Rule9: Under the condition that the technician is using proper personal protective equipment, it is not the case that there is a safety violation in the workshop.
Rule10: Either the technician is using proper personal protective equipment or the workshop has adequate ventilation.
Rule11: Whenever the workshop has adequate ventilation, the equipment in the workshop is grounded.
Rule12: Either the workshop has an emergency protocol or if the equipment in the workshop is grounded, then it is not the case that there is a safety violation in the workshop.
Rule13: Either the components were tested or if the power supply is undamaged, then it is not the case that the motherboard is damaged.
Rule14: Either there was an incorrect diagnosis of the fault or it is not the case that the components were tested.
Rule15: Whenever the test was successful, it is not the case that there was an incorrect diagnosis of the fault.
Rule16: Either the motherboard is damaged or if the multimeter is calibrated, then the multimeter is functional.
Rule17: If there is a replacement available for the motherboard, then it is not the case that the motherboard is damaged.
Rule18: Either there is a replacement available for the motherboard or the motherboard can be salvaged.
Rule19: If the workshop has adequate lighting, then the tools are organized.
Rule20: Under the condition that the workshop has adequate lighting, it is not the case that the tools are accessible.
Rule21: Provided that it is not the case that if the repair was verified then the test was successful, rework is needed for the repair.
Rule22: If it is not the case that if the technician is skilled then if the motherboard can be salvaged, it is not the case that the motherboard is damaged, then the workshop has backup power.

Rule23: Under the condition that it is not the case that if the technician is skilled then if the motherboard can be salvaged, it is not the case that the motherboard is damaged, the workshop has adequate lighting.

Rule24: Whenever it is not the case that if the technician is skilled then if the motherboard can be salvaged, it is not the case that the motherboard is damaged, it is not the case that the workshop has backup power.
Rule25: Provided that it is not the case that the device is powered on, the technician is familiar with the schematics.
Rule26: Under the condition that it is not the case that the device is powered on, the multimeter is calibrated.
Rule27: If it is not the case that the device is powered on, then it is not the case that the multimeter is functional.
facts: Fact1: The power supply is undamaged.
